Museums & Heritage.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya
Museums & Heritage.description: A majestic Indo‑Saracenic museum situated in Fort/Kala Ghoda (South Mumbai), housing ~50,000 artefacts—from archaeology and art to natural history.

Cultural / Religious Sites.name: Siddhivinayak Temple
Cultural / Religious Sites.description: One of Mumbai’s most visited Hindu temples, dedicated to Lord Ganesha; attracts large numbers of devotees and pilgrims.

Cultural / Religious Sites.name: Haji Ali Dargah
Cultural / Religious Sites.description: A striking Indo‑Islamic mosque and tomb built on a small islet off Worli, connected via a narrow causeway. Renowned for its marble courtyard and spiritual ambiance.

Beaches, Promenades & Viewpoints.name: Marine Drive
Beaches, Promenades & Viewpoints.description: Mumbai’s 3 km-long crescent promenade along the Arabian Sea. Named for how its streetlights sparkle like a necklace at night.

Beaches, Promenades & Viewpoints.name: Juhu Beach
Beaches, Promenades & Viewpoints.description: A bustling, expansive beach in suburban Mumbai, famed for evening crowds, street food, and sunset views.

Iconic Landmarks & Must-Sees.name: Gateway of India
Iconic Landmarks & Must-Sees.description: A grand basalt arch monument built in Indo‑Saracenic style to commemorate George V’s visit. A symbolic entrance and signature icon of Mumbai.

Iconic Landmarks & Must-Sees.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus (CST)
Iconic Landmarks & Must-Sees.description: Victorian Gothic‑Revival railway station and UNESCO World Heritage site. Noted for ornate architecture blending British and Indian motifs.

Iconic Landmarks & Must-Sees.name: Elephanta Caves
Iconic Landmarks & Must-Sees.description: Ancient rock-cut cave temples dating back to the 7th century, dedicated primarily to Shiva. UNESCO World Heritage site reached via ferry from Gateway of India.

Additional Notable Spots.name: Aarey Milk Colony
Additional Notable Spots.description: Green expanse in Goregaon East—picnic lawns, gardens, nursery, often called Mumbai’s green lung.

Additional Notable Spots.name: Sanjay Gandhi National Park
Additional Notable Spots.description: Expansive protected forest in northern Mumbai, with Kanheri Caves and wildlife.

Additional Notable Spots.name: Bandra–Worli Sea Link (Rajiv Gandhi Sea Link)
Additional Notable Spots.description: 5.6 km cable-stayed bridge linking Bandra to Worli; sleek modern engineering landmark.

Additional Notable Spots.name: Atal Setu (Mumbai Trans Harbour Link)
Additional Notable Spots.description: India’s longest sea bridge (21.8 km), linking Sewri (Mumbai) to Nhava Sheva; opened Jan 2024.

Additional Notable Spots.name: Prong’s Lighthouse (Colaba Lighthouse)
Additional Notable Spots.description: Heritage stone lighthouse at Colaba Point marking entrance to Mumbai Harbour.

Additional Notable Spots.name: Manori Island
Additional Notable Spots.description: Quaint northern Mumbai beach village on Dharavi Bet, known for its laid‑back seaside charm.

Additional Notable Spots.name: Madh Island
Additional Notable Spots.description: Cluster of fishing villages and beaches with Portuguese‑era Madh Fort nearby.
